MS MCQs

    Discover how your organization can achieve more with Surface for Business and Microsoft 365

    »

    1. How do Surface for Business devices drive employee engagement and retention?

      Surface for Business devices decrease the cost of hardware to an organization, and that is what drives retention.

      With Surface Hub devices in an office, employees feel compelled to work only in the office, which drives retention.

      Paired with Microsoft 365, Surface for Business devices can improve employee productivity, creativity, and mobility.


    2. How do Surface for Business devices that run Microsoft 365 benefit IT organizations?

      Surface for Business Devices run Windows 10 easily but do not run Office 365.

      Surface devices that run Microsoft 365 are easy to deploy and manage with Intune, while protected by the security of Windows 10 Pro.

      Because Surface for Business devices are physically locked to an employees’ desk, IT can manage local devices more easily.


    3. What are the most important benefits of running Microsoft 365 software on the Surface for Business hardware it was built for, for an organization?

      With Surface, some employees can work wherever they want to, and some others can utilize the optimized battery life and portability.

      Surface for Business devices can only be updated with Microsoft 365 software every other year, so IT doesn’t have to deal with updates so often.

      Running Microsoft 365 on Surface devices provides a powerful user experience, offers advanced security, and empowers employees to do more.
